title: White Africans of European ancestry
summary: White Africans of European ancestry refers to people in Africa who can trace full, or partial ancestry to Europe. In 1989, there were an estimated 4.6 million white people with European ancestry on the African continent.[1] Most are of Dutch, Portuguese, British, German and French origin; and to a lesser extent there are also those who descended from Italians, Spaniards, Greeks, and Scandinavians. The majority once lived along the Mediterranean coast or in Southern Africa.[1]
